intro: Schiedea mannii, commonly known as the Maui snowplant, is a rare endemic species native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its rosette growth form and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Schiedea mannii thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in coastal forests and rocky habitats. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
